caption: Aircraft Surveillance Activity
description: Aircraft Surveillance Activity events report the activity of any aircraft or unmanned system as reported and tracked by Automatic Dependent Surveillance - Broadcast (ADS-B) receivers. Based on the ADS-B standards described in Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Title 14 Chapter I Subchapter F Part 91 and in other general Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) supplemental orders and guidance described here>.
name: aircraft_surveillance_activity

2.caption: Record
2.description: ADS-B information is being recorded, for example by a standalone transceiver.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

protocol_name.caption: ADS-B Protocol
protocol_name.description: The specific protocol associated with the ADS-B system. E.g. ADS-B UAT or ADS-B ES.

traffic.description: Traffic refers to the amount of data transmitted from a ADS-B remote monitoring system at a given point of time. Ex: bytes_in and bytes_out.
